data.title: Books, Reports, Etc
meta_keywords: books reports collections two rivers history bonner montana
data.meta_description: Books, Reports & Collections - Two Rivers History - Bonner, Montana
data.text:
Books, Reports & Collections

The following resource list comes from Minie Smith's script for Just Add Water: An Exploration of the Milltown Dam and Its Communities, a 2006 exhibit at the Historical Museum at Fort Missoula.

Books and Thesis:

Bateman, Bob Big Blackfoot Railway (Deer Lodge MT: Platen Press, 1974)

Bicentennial Committee Bonner School, A Grass Roots Tribute: The Story of Bonner, Montana (Missoula MT: Gateway Press, 1976)

Bradshaw, Glenda Clay Montana’s Historical Highway Markers (Helena Mt: Montana Historical Society, 1999)

Dedman, Bill and Paul Clark Newell Empty Mansions: The Mysterious Life of Huguette Clark and the Spending of a Great American Fortune (New York NY: Ballentine Books, 2014)

Federal Writers Project, Montana A State Guidebook (New York: Viking Press, 1939

Freeman, Harry C. A Brief History of Butte Montana (Chicago: The Henry O. Shepard Company, 1900)

Glasscock. C.B. The War of the Copper Kings (New York: Grosset & Dunlop, 1966)

Gordon, Greg When Money Grew on Trees: A. B. Hammond and the Age of the Timber Baron (Norman OK: University of Oklahoma Press, 2014)

Johnson, Dale, Andrew B. Hammond: Education of a Capitalist on the Montana Frontier, PhD Thesis (Missoula MT: University of Montana, 1976)

Koelbel, Lenora Missoula The Way It Was Missoula MT: Gateway Print and Litho, 1972)

Long, Wallace and David A. Lake The Hisotry of Lothrop, Montana and Petty Creek (Lolo MT: Merkat Graphics, 1996)

Malone, MichaelP. Richard B. Roeder and William Lang, Montana A History of Two Centuries Rev. Ed. (Seattle: University of Washington, 1976)

Mangam, William D. The Clarks An American Phenomenon (New York: Silver Bow Press, 1941)

Matthews, James Allen A Guide to Historic Missoula (Helena MT: Montana Historical Society, 2002)

McCarter, Steve, Guide to the Milwaukee Road in Montana (Helena MT: Montana Historical Society, 1992)

Montana Power Company The Story of Montana Power (Butte MT: Montana Power Co., 1941(?)

Mullan, Capt. John, Report on the Construction of a Military Road from Fort Walla-Walla to Fort Benton (Fairfield WA: Ye Galleon Press, 1998) pp 31-33

Pierson, Gladys, Acculturation of the Finns in Milltown, Montana MA Thesis (Missoula MT: University of Montana, 1941)

Salish Pend d’Oreille Culture Committee and Elders Cultural Advisory Committee, Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes, The Salish People and the Lewis and Clark Expedition (Lincoln: University of Nebraska, 2005) p. 51

Smith, Minie The Missoula Mercantile: The Store that Ran an Empire (Charleston SC: The History Press, 2012)

Spritzer, Don Roadside History of Montana (Missoula: Mountain Press Publishing Co, 1999

Toole, John H. The Baron, The Logger, The Miner and Me (John H. Toole, 1974)

Reports

Bolle, Arnold W., William K. Gibson and Elizabeth Hannum, The Forest Products Industry in Montana (Missoula): Montana Forest and Conservation Experiment Station Bull No 31, May 1966)

Historical Research Associates, Inc., Cultural Resource Report Milltown Reservoir Sediments Site, Missoula Montana (Fort Collins CO: ARCO Coal Company, Division of Atlantic Richfield Company, ENSR Consulting and Engineering, Oct. 1990)

Quivik, Fredric L. Milltown Dam A Determination of Eligibility for the National Register of Historic Places (Butte: Renewable Technologies Inc., Nov. 1984)

Strohmaier, David, Cultural Resources Report for Bonner Dam Removal Project (Missoula MT: Historical research Associates Inc., 2005

Collections

Audra Browman Papers, K Ross Toole Archives, The University of Montana, Missoula, Series VI, Research Caard File, 8 linear feet, undated.

Demmons Photo Collection, Bonner School, Bonner MT

Guide to Montana Power Company Records 1892-1967, K Ross Toole Archives, The University of Montana, Missoula, Mss 240.

Guide to Anaconda Forest Products Company Records 1890-1971, K Ross Toole Archives, The University of Montana, Missoula, Mss 057.

Montana Memory Project: Demmons Photo Collection on-line
